field_edited_text.value:
ENGINEERING PROCEDURE 11

B. A map of the vicinity, showing the relation of the crossing
to other roads, streets, etc., in the vicinity.

C. A general elevation and plan of the structure, including such
approaches as are intended to be made a part of the struc-
ture 1itself.

D. A typical cross section of the structure, or in case of different
types, a typical cross section for each type of span or part
included in the entire structure.

E. Typical pier and abutment drawings, in sufficient detail to
fix generally the dimensions of the structure and the type
of construction, in order to be able to estimate accurately,
quantities of construction materials required.

F. Development of the toll plaza at each structure, to include
administration building, toll booths, division of main
traffic lanes into secondary lanes at the toll booths. Due
consideration was given in this layout to the possibility of
future extensions required on account of increasing volume
of traffic.

G. Outline sketches to indicate lighting requirements on such
structures where lighting will be necessary.

H. Preliminary plans, all in sufficient detail for accurately esti-
mating volumes of construction materials.

I. Complete estimate of cost of all items of construction, taking
the following information into full consideration—

a. The source of supply of materials and assurance that
the supply is adequate, and will not be depleted
due to the large drain during the simultaneous con-
struction of a program of this extent.

b. A survey of the labor conditions with respect to the
use of union labor, relief labor, free lance labor and
all other available sources of labor supply, in order
to determine whether or not the progress of this
program will involve the possibility of labor short-
ages which may materially affect the cost of labor.

J. Estimate of annual maintenance expenses to include the
following items:—

a. Machinery and equipment renewals.

b. Pavement maintenance and replacement reserve.
